title: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
Hi guys, my name is James. I used to be active in CC314's forums way back when Geoff was running it and the message board was on InsideTheWeb...I guess that was around 1998? After that, I kind of vanished, made a very brief reappearance a few years ago (I don't even remember when exactly), vanished again, and now I'm hopefully back here to stay. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

A little bit of background info: I'm 20 years old, I live in Tennessee, and I'm in my third year of college, majoring in music.

So yeah, that's me in a nutshell. If you want to know more, ask and ye shall receive. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] "A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
The InsideTheWeb board was a bit before my time, but welcome back! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ------------------
www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk My website is going to go back online
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: hmm.
content:
I was around for the tail-end of the ItW days--were you "Master Inferno" at that time, too, or did you go under a different name?

Either way, welcome back. We've got a Keen2 level competition that's just wrapping up--if you haven't had a chance to play it yet, you should; it's a team effort!

title: Re: hmm.
content:
Hi! I wasn't around at that time, but welcome back. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You have a lot catching up to do, there's a ton new Keen stuff since 1998. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] What made you return? (It's good that you did, of course!) Nostalgia? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: hmm.
content:
I came in Nov of 2001, so that's quite a while ago, but '98? lol, welcome back, old guy!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content: Majoring in music???  You know, there are a lot of good Keen tunes, and [url=http://www.ocremix.org/quicksearch/game/?qs_query=Commander+Keen]not a lot of remixes[/url]...

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
Seriously, lol, Keen needs some more remixes!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
ElecDude33: Thanks. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Xky: Yes, I remember you. I didn't go by Master Inferno back then, I just used my real name (James Swanson). A Keen2 level competition, you say? I've not checked around the other sections of this forum yet...what does this level competition entail?

KeenRush: Yes, I'd say nostalgia is the main thing. I was on Facebook one day last week and there was a Commander Keen group with a link to the flash port of Keen 1, and that's basically what got me interested in coming back.

Malvineous & LordOfGlobox: I would love to do some remix-type stuff, however I am currently lacking in the money, tools, and most importantly, disk space for such endeavors at the moment. I have a lot of music stuff planned out in my head, but I'm not able to do anything with it right now, which makes me feel about like this: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

Also, Malvineous, I played Xargon too. Most excellent game. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] "A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
The level competition is over. Xky just wanted you to check out the finished product. It was to design a Keen 2 style level. There should be a Keen 3 one coming, soon.

Commander Keen group on Facebook? Someone should tell them about this site (unless they ARE from this site...)-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
Hello, Mr. Master Inferno. This is the Shadow Master, I don't know you, you don't know me. Believe me, our user names are sheer coincidence.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

title: Re: I doubt anyone remembers me, but I'm back.
content:
Yeah, Xargon and Jill use the same map format, but both suffer from the same problem - it looks like there's no "automatic" way to map things in the object-layer (points, enemies, etc.) to images, which means I'll have to map them all by hand, which will be tedious and error-prone (and yes, this is how JillEdit does it.)

But I agree that the Xargon music is great - it's just a shame AdPlug doesn't play the percussion properly, otherwise it'd be in my playlist more often [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
